Class Util

    • org.jpws.pwslib.global.Util

extends org.jpws.pwslib.global.Util
    Various useful functions of general purpose.

      • wipeAFile

        public static void wipeAFile(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts at destroying the contents of a file safely and persistently according to security specific methods. Deletes the parameter file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be wiped out
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • directorySize

        public static long directorySize(java.io.File path,
                                 int clusterSize)
        Attempts to calculate the storage size of a file directory.

        Since the operation is non-atomic, the returned value may be inaccurate. However, this method is quick and does its best.

        Parameters:
        path - Path the directory denomination
        clusterSize - int target file system cluster size, if 0 then only plain file sizes are summed up, otherwise occupied device space
        Returns:
        long size in bytes of directory, traversing

      • blankFileSpace

        public static final void blankFileSpace(java.io.RandomAccessFile f,
                                        long off,
                                        long length)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Fills a specified section of the parameter file with zero (byte 0) values.
        Parameters:
        f - RandomAccessFile
        off - start offset in file of blank section; if below 0 the function works from the current file pointer position
        length - length of blank section
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fillFileSpace

        public static final void fillFileSpace(java.io.RandomAccessFile f,
                                       long off,
                                       long length,
                                       byte[] pattern,
                                       int cyclus)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Fills a specified section of the parameter file with a given pattern value.
        Parameters:
        f - RandomAccessFile
        off - start offset in file of destined pattern section; if below 0 the function works from the current file pointer position
        length - length of pattern section
        pattern - byte array containing a cyclic pattern
        cyclus - length of the pattern element; if greater 0 then length must obey length % cyclus == 0
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a mismatch in parameters

      • scatter

        public static void scatter(byte[] buffer,
                           int length,
                           boolean enscatter)
        Makes a scrambles of the user record (buffer) over the specified length only. This works resembling to a mirror and can both en-scatter and de-scatter a set of data, depending on the parameter switch enscatter.

        (Note that this algorithm is not bound onto a cyclic block length, while the cipher is.)

        Parameters:
        buffer -
        length -
        enscatter - boolean switch of the transformation direction. true = enscatter, false = descatter

      • centredWindowLocation

        public static java.awt.Point centredWindowLocation(java.awt.Rectangle rec,
                                                   java.awt.Dimension dim)
        Calculates the X and Y coordinates that a child component should have to be centred within its parent. This method does not try to constrain the calculation so that the point remains on visible screen.
        Parameters:
        rec - the bounding rectangle of the parent.
        dim - the dimensions of the child.
        Returns:
        the X and Y coordinates the child should have.

      • centreWithin

        public static void centreWithin(java.awt.Component parent,
                                java.awt.Component child)
        Centres the child component within its parent. Does nothing if child is null.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent component; null defaults to system screen
        child - the child component; may be null

      • setCorrectedLocation

        public static void setCorrectedLocation(java.awt.Component c,
                                        java.awt.Point p)
        Sets the location of a window c to screen point p by correcting point p if necessary to ensure that the window is as fully visible as possible. Does nothing if any of the parameters is null.
        Parameters:
        c - Component window to check
        p - Point intended position of window (upper left corner)

      • correctedWindowBounds

        public static java.awt.Rectangle correctedWindowBounds(java.awt.Rectangle win,
                                                       boolean resizable,
                                                       boolean clipping)
        Defines new window bounds (location + dimension) by interpreting the relation of a window win to the size of the current system screen (primary display). Window locations are expressed in coordinates of the screen.
        Parameters:
        win - Rectangle window size and position in screen coordinates
        resizable - boolean if true the window will get resized if it exceeds screen limits
        clipping - boolean if true it is ok if only a part of the window is visible on the screen while its top-bar remains functional
        Returns:
        Rectangle new bounds definition (potentially corrected) of window win

      • correctedWindowBounds

        public static java.awt.Rectangle correctedWindowBounds(java.awt.Dimension screen,
                                                       java.awt.Rectangle win,
                                                       boolean resizable,
                                                       boolean clipping)
        Defines new window bounds (location + dimension) by interpreting the relation of a window win to a screen dimension screen. Window locations are expressed in coordinates of the screen. Returns null if window was null.
        Parameters:
        screen - Dimension the screen dimensions in x and y coordinates; null defaults to system screen
        win - Rectangle window size and position in screen coordinates
        resizable - boolean if true the window will get resized if it exceeds screen limits
        clipping - boolean if true it is ok if only a part of the window is visible on the screen while its top-bar remains functional
        Returns:
        Rectangle new bounds definition (potentially corrected) of window win or null if win was null

        Parameters:
        path - input file or directory path, may be null
        Returns:
        file/directory name or empty string

      • htmlEncoded

        public static java.lang.String htmlEncoded(java.lang.String text)

        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        String

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(java.io.File inputFile,
                            java.io.File outputFile)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the contents of any disk file to a specified output file. If the output file is a relative path, it is made absolute against the directory of the input file. The output file will be overwritten if it exist. A CRC32 check is performed to compare source and copy after the copy process and if results negative a StreamCorruptedException is thrown. Function reports errors to System.err. The filetime of output will be the same as of input.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - a File object
        outputFile - a File object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the function could not be completed because of an IO or CRC check error

      • ensureFilePath

        public static boolean ensureFilePath(java.io.File file,
                                     java.io.File defaultDir)
        Ensures the existence of the directory which may be part of the path specification of parameter file. If the specified file is a relative path, it is made absolute against defaultDir. If defaultDir is null the System property "user.home" is assumed as default directory. Does nothing if file is null (return == false).
        Returns:
        true if and only if the parent directory of the specified file exists after this function terminates

      • ensureDirectory

        public static boolean ensureDirectory(java.io.File dir,
                                      java.io.File defaultDir)
        Ensures the existence of the directory specified by the parameter. If the directory does not exist, an attempt is performed to create it including all necessary parent directories that may be implied by the specification. Does nothing if dir is null (return == false).
        Parameters:
        dir - File specifying the intended directory; if the specified path is a relative path, it is made absolute against defaultDir.
        defaultDir - File base directory in case dir specified a relative path. If defaultDir is null the System directory "user.home" is assumed. If defaultDir is a relative path it is made absolute against the "user.home" directory.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the specified file exists after execution of this method and is a directory

        public static boolean isFileProtocol(java.net.URL url)
        Whether the parameter URL is denoting a file protocol.
        Parameters:
        url -
        Returns:
        true if and only if url is not null and its protocol part equals to "file"

      • isFileProtocol

        public static boolean isFileProtocol(java.lang.String path)
        Whether the parameter filepath is denoting a file protocol.
        Parameters:
        path - String file path
        Returns:
        true if and only if path is not null and not malformed and its URL equivalent renders a "file" protocol

      • topMostStr

        public static java.lang.String topMostStr(java.lang.String v,
                                          int max)

        Parameters:
        v - String input
        max - maximum length the returned string shall assume
        Returns:
        String either v or a bottom shortened string of v

      • timeFromString

        public static long timeFromString(java.lang.String input,
                                  java.util.TimeZone tz)
        Extracts a long time value from a given text string formatted according to standard time format.
        Parameters:
        input - standard time formatted text
        tz - the TimeZone of the input value or null for the current default time zone
        Returns:
        long time value or -1 if parse failed

      • timeFromSECPath

        public static long timeFromSECPath(java.lang.String path)
        Returns the millisecond time value of the time marker within a SEC (security) backup file path. (The marker text is interpreted as of the GMT timezone.)
        Parameters:
        path - filepath of a SEC- marked backup file
        Returns:
        long time value (milliseconds) or -1 if no valid time value found
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • longFromString

        public static long longFromString(java.lang.String val)
        Returns the parsed long value from parameter text or 0 if not successful.
        Parameters:
        val - String text containing number (may be null)
        Returns:
        parsed long value or 0 if text was null or unreadable

      • extractURL

        public static java.net.URL extractURL(java.lang.String text)
        Extracts the first occurrence of a valid URL within the given text string as a java.net.URL object.
        Parameters:
        text - url specification or null
        Returns:
        java.net.URL or null if no valid URL was found
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • extractURLs

        public static java.net.URL[] extractURLs(java.lang.String text)
        Extracts all occurrences of valid URLs within the given text string as an array of java.net.URL objects. Multiple identical URLs are returned as one URL.
        Parameters:
        text - String text to be investigated; may be null
        Returns:
        Array of java.net.URL or null if no valid URL was found
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • boundsToLong

      • longToBounds

        public static java.awt.Rectangle longToBounds(long v)

      • getUnixDevices

        public static java.lang.String[][] getUnixDevices()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an array with device descriptors of the type String[]. Each descriptor holds 2 entries with index 0=unix device name (e.g. "/dev/sdc1") and 1=drive name in directory tree (e.g. "/media/USB DISK").
        Returns:
        String[][] array of device descriptors, or null if current operating system is not a Unix derivate
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if required system information could not be obtained

      • findRoot

        public static java.io.File findRoot(java.io.File file)
        Returns the file-system root directory (device name) for the given file.
        Parameters:
        file - File file to investigate (may be null)
        Returns:
        root directory of file or null if not found

      • findTrunks

        public static java.lang.String[] findTrunks(java.lang.String s1,
                                            java.lang.String s2)
        Returns the truncated versions of the parameter strings where the equal TRAILING part of both strings is cut off.

        Example: s1="a:/hanuman/zwei", s2="c:/programs/jpws/zwei" returns {"a:/hanuman", "c:/programs/jpws"}; s1="a:/hanuman/zwei", s2="c:/programs/jpws/fuenf" returns {"a:/hanuman/zwei", "c:/programs/jpws/fuenf"}; s1.equals(s2) returns two empty strings.

        Parameters:
        s1 - String 1
        s2 - String 2
        Returns:
        String[] of size 2

      • fingerPrint

        public static byte[] fingerPrint(java.lang.String buffer)
        Returns a SHA-256 fingerprint value of the parameter string buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - String data to digest
        Returns:
        SHA256 digest

      • isEmailAddress

        public static boolean isEmailAddress(java.lang.String hstr)
        Returns true if and only if the parameter string complies with some formal requirements for an email address. Note that leading and trailing blanks in the string are ignored.
        Parameters:
        hstr - String text
        Returns:
        boolean

      • containsChar

        public static boolean containsChar(char[] arr,
                                   char c)
        Whether a specified character is contained in a char array.
        Parameters:

        c - char search character
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if c is an element of the character set defined by arr

      • containsDigit

        public static boolean containsDigit(char[] arr)
        Whether the given char array contains a digit character.
        Parameters:
        arr - char[] to be investigated
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if there is at least one character of the range '0'..'9' contained in the array

      • textDomainVariance

        public static int textDomainVariance(char[] ca)
        Returns a value of 0..4 indicating how many separate character domains are referenced by the character set defined through the given character array.
        Parameters:
        ca - char[] character set to investigate
        Returns:
        int, result value 0..4

      • extractMailaddress

        public static java.lang.String extractMailaddress(java.lang.String text)
        Investigates all separatable parts of the parameter text and returns the first occurrence of a valid email address or null if none found.
        Parameters:
        text - Sting text to investigate
        Returns:
        String email address or null

      • reducedText

        public static java.lang.String reducedText(java.lang.String text,
                                           java.lang.String exclude,
                                           boolean blanks)
        Returns the parameter text string reduced by all occurrences of characters which are elements in the exclude string (char set). Optionally such occurrences can get replaced by blank characters and results in a returned string of the length of the input string.
        Parameters:
        text - String input text
        exclude - String set of characters to be excluded
        blanks - boolean if true occurrences will be replaced by blanks
        Returns:
        String operated text

      • extractMailAddresses

        public static java.lang.String[] extractMailAddresses(java.lang.String text)
        Extracts all occurrences of valid Email Address within the given text string as an array of java.lang.String objects. Multiple identical addresses are returned as one address.
        Parameters:
        text - String text to be investigated; may be null
        Returns:
        Array of java.lang.String or null if no valid address was found
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(long millis)
        Makes the current thread sleep for the given time. (Convenience method to avoid the try-catch statement, which is executed with "e.printStackTrace()" when InterruptedException is thrown.)
        Parameters:
        millis - long milliseconds sleep time

      • iterString

        public static java.lang.String iterString(char c,
                                          int length)
        Returns a string of a given length which consists only of characters of type c.
        Parameters:
        c - char stamp character
        length - length of result string
        Returns:
        String
